meanings.definition: A person who abides by rules or laws.
meanings.sent1: The abiders in our community always follow the rules.
meanings.sent2: The abiders in the group never break any laws.
meanings.sent3: The abiders at the party made sure to respect the house rules.
meanings.sent4: She was like one of those abiders in a storybook, always doing what was right.
meanings.sent5: The abiders in the town were known for their honesty and integrity.

meanings.definition: Those who remain steadfast or continue to exist.
meanings.sent1: Even after the storm, the abiders of the village stayed strong.
meanings.sent2: The abiders of the old traditions kept their customs alive.
meanings.sent3: The abiders of the group were like rocks, unchanging and reliable.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood were the abiders of her past.
meanings.sent5: The abiders of the forest, the ancient trees, stood tall and proud.
